lead_paragraph: GREASON--Mary Twomey, of Manhattan and Quogue, NY passed away peacefully on January 9th, surrounded by her loving family, after a brief and sudden illness. Mary was born January 15, 1932 in the Bronx to Timothy and Anna (nee King) Twomey. Mary was a wonderful and loving wife, mother, grandmother, and friend to all who met her. She is survived by Edward W. Greason, her husband of nearly 61 years, her sons Edward and his wife Marisa, William and his wife Margaret, and Michael, her granddaughter Elizabeth, and brother-in-law Robert, as well as many nieces, nephews and cousins. Among her many accomplishments, she was most proud of graduating from Marymount Manhattan College, where she later served as a Trustee for 19 years and received the College's President's Medal of Honor. Visiting at Frank E. Campbell "The Funeral Chapel" Madison Ave and 81st Street, on Tuesday, January 12, from 3-5pm and 7-9pm. Funeral mass will be held at 11am on January 13 at Our Lady of Peace Church, 237 East 62nd Street, New York City. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the Mary T. Greason Scholarship Fund at Marymount Manhattan College or to Memorial Sloan Kettering Hospital. 1/3
